"The Red Violin" is a movie in which a violin is the main character. The movie was filmed from the violinâ€™s point of view. From its birth during the 1600s in Cremona the world capital for Italian handcrafted violins. To its ownership by an English lord in Britain during the 1800s Victorian royal era. Then, its near destruction in Shanghai during the 1900s Cultural Revolution wars. And eventually, its restoration and auction for $2.4 million in modern day Montreal.

Violins are like humans. Each has its own history and they have life spans longer than humans. From now onwards, their stories won't be lost in time but remembered by an authentication tag technolgy called Blocktag. The tag is printed and attached to a violin. Scan the Blocktagged violin with your phone camera and you can watch the real life version of "The Red Violin".

Blocktag is the eternal memory body of the violin.
